image.altText: Brian Mier, dressed in short-sleeved shirt, examines a large lump on his arm.

props.synopsis: Victoria's planned surgery waitlist has been growing again, with warnings many are still languishing in a "hidden" queue in the state's complex health system.

title.children: As Victoria's surgery waitlist grows, so do concerns over a 'hidden' queue

image.altText: man with faded red bucket hat, navy tshirt holds steering wheel inside tractor cabin with 4 young boys, 2 seated on each side

props.synopsis: In Australia the Crown owns all resources under the ground, regardless of who owns the property. Therefore the Byrne family face a lengthy and costly legal battle with limited prospects of success.

title.children: Fifth-generation farming family determined to protect their land from miners

image.altText: A man with scarring on his nose looks off to the side of the camera

props.synopsis: A person living in the Loddon Mallee region of Victoria is 34 per cent more likely to get skin cancer than other Victorians. A team of researchers and doctors are working to improve health outcomes.

title.children: Skin cancer diagnosis trial to upskill GPs, use AI in Victoria's north-west

image.altText: people in armour smashing lances on horseback

props.synopsis: Thousands of spectators stepped into the faux-medieval world of Kryal Castle in Ballarat to watch jousting's answer to cricket's Ashes rivalry.

title.children: Australia takes on age-old rivals England in The Smashes jousting battle

image.altText: A wrecked car.

props.synopsis: Police say the crash scene in Rowville, in Melbourne's south-east, was discovered by another motorist in the early hours of Sunday morning.

title.children: Two teenagers die after crashing allegedly stolen car in Melbourne

image.altText: NSW police generic; blue and red lights on top of Newcastle car

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after a man's body was found near the Victoria-NSW border this morning after reportedly being hit by two cars.

title.children: Man's body found on Hume Highway near Victoria-NSW border

image.altText: Mansell2

props.synopsis: Richmond forward Rhyan Mansell could face three weeks on the sidelines in a landmark suspension that would set the tone for the AFL moving forward.

title.children: Tigers forward faces landmark suspension over push that left Saint concussed

image.altText: Caleb Serong smiles while wearing the Glendinning-Allan Medal

props.synopsis: Fremantle dominates Western Derby 60 and runs out 38-point winners over a poor West Coast, with Caleb Serong winning his fourth Glendinning-Allan Medal, after Adelaide saw off North Melbourne to remain unbeaten.

title.children: Serong ties derby record as Dockers dominate Eagles in battle of the west

image.altText: A malleefowl in the bush

props.synopsis: A vulnerable population of ground-dwelling malleefowl survived bushfires that tore through one of its few remaining refuges in Victoria, but the remaining hatchlings now face a new challenge.

title.children: Vulnerable bird builds 'ingenious' nests to survive bushfires

image.altText: A map of Melbourne showing electorates.

props.synopsis: Both major parties know Victoria, and in particular Melbourne, will play a major role in determining who wins the federal election. These are the seats to keep an eye on.

title.children: These Victorian seats will be crucial in the upcoming federal election

image.altText: Two photographers take photo of Caz Heise and David Pocock

props.synopsis: Sitting federal independents have hit the hustings outside their own electorates, mentoring and campaigning for those who hope to follow in their footsteps to Canberra.

title.children: Independents 'pay it forward' in place of a party machine

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446971

props.synopsis: The leaders of Melbourne Victory's North Terrace supporter group boycotted the club's Pride Cup game against Adelaide United.

title.children: Melbourne Victory supporter group slammed over Pride Cup boycott

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a straight face, He's wearing a blue singlet and a cap.

props.synopsis: Clinton Austin was said to be struggling to breathe, vomiting and sweating through his clothes before he died while serving a sentence for aggravated burglary.

title.children: Prisoner told he had gastro found dead in cell hours later, inquest told

image.altText: A photo of pilot Glenn Collins.

props.synopsis: The airshow is resuming on Saturday following a crash on Friday that left NSW pilot Glenn Collins with critical injuries.

title.children: Pilot critical but stable after crash at Avalon International Airshow

image.altText: Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy hit the line in the 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout may have finished second to Lachlan Kennedy in a thrilling 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet in Melbourne, but the 17-year-old took valuable lessons away from the defeat.

title.children: 'Fuel to my fire': How Gout Gout will learn from loss to Australian rival

image.altText: A man in a retail store standing in front of a rack of scooters and skateboards.

props.synopsis: With retail thefts almost doubling since 2022, traders dealing with the cost-of-living crunch are devastated when stolen stock disappears out their doors.

title.children: Shoplifters make life even harder for regional traders

image.altText: Two cats sitting on a scratching post ledge watching a movie on an iPad screen.

props.synopsis: An animal hospital in Melbourne has found cats and kittens that watch TV shows on iPads are more likely to be adopted and well socialised.

title.children: Melbourne animal hospital trials iPads for cats to help them de-stress

image.altText: An indian woman in her 30s smiles at the camera in a door frame

props.synopsis: Curry is a dish that has become symbolic of Indian cuisine, but the word itself doesn't originate from India, and many Indian people bristle at its association with their culture.

title.children: Curry has become symbolic of Indian cuisine, but it's more complicated

image.altText: A boy with spiky black hair in a white singlet jumps in the air aiming a basketball at a hoop as players gather around him.

props.synopsis: The number of aspiring Australians being awarded sporting scholarships to American colleges is rising each year, with one Melbourne-based program breaking its own record.

title.children: Expat lands record number of US scholarships for Aussie basketballers

image.altText: A person wearing a grey hoodie pulled over his head and a black face mask carries a parcel and stares off screen at night.

props.synopsis: Police allege the man forced the woman to drive around Melbourne's south-east to buy laptops while he kept her baby with him in the car.

title.children: Man charged with 2024 abduction of mother, baby from shopping centre

image.altText: a little girl holds a photo of her dad

props.synopsis: Harley Muir, 29, died from crush injuries in 2021 after he became entangled while working on a multibaler machine at a factory in Bridgewater, near Bendigo.

title.children: Company fined $400k after worker crushed to death at hay baling plant

image.altText: Caleb sitting on the beach digging a hole in the sand smiling.

props.synopsis: Residents living near the road where a  young boy was hit and killed by a car at Teesdale on Thursday say they had pleaded for safety improvements for years.

title.children: Road safety fears were raised years before 6yo boy fatally struck

image.altText: Spencer Shumski outside court.

props.synopsis: Spencer Shumski, 22, has been sentenced to jail with a non-parole period of three years after fatally stabbing a 38-year-old Victorian father who was celebrating his wife's birthday in 2023. With time served, Shumski will be eligible for parole in May next year.

title.children: Judge in fatal stabbing case urges young people to 'stop carrying knives'

image.altText: Czarina Gatbonton Tumaliuan smiles at the camera standing in a city at night.

props.synopsis: A 41-year-old man has appeared before the Melbourne Magistrates' Court charged with the alleged murder of his wife.

title.children: Mum of four allegedly murdered by husband in Melbourne's west

image.altText: A Melbourne bus at a bus stop near where stabbings occurred

props.synopsis: Police allege a man "slashed" two people unknown to him across the face following an argument on a Melbourne bus overnight, one of whom is now in a critical condition.

title.children: Man charged with stabbing two people on Melbourne bus

image.altText: Two football players stretch for the ball

props.synopsis: The first month of the SANFL boasts some "marquee" games as several are played under lights, a rematch between last year's grand finalists looms, and the league's best will face off against arch rivals the VFL in both the men's and women's sides.

title.children: SANFL season kicks off featuring Saturday night TV broadcast

image.altText: A sign on the front of a building saying 'Genius Childcare', photographed through bars.

props.synopsis: After months of complaints about unpaid wages, landlord disputes and child health and safety breaches, Genius has sold off at least six childcare centres.

title.children: Failed childcare boss sells six Genius centres to ex-business partner

image.altText: Noah Balta, wearing a black gurnsey with yellow sash, celebrates next to the goal post

props.synopsis: A New South Wales court is played vision of AFL footballer Noah Balta assaulting a man in a Mulwala pub car park.

title.children: Police seek jail for AFL star after brutal assault aired in court

image.altText: A portrait of Queen Mary of Denmark in a long dress with lace details on the sleeves and a crown.

props.synopsis: Genius move or "cheeky European vacay"? A cost-cutting regional council has narrowly voted to send its mayor and the city band on an expenses-paid trip to entice Queen Mary into a reciprocal visit.

title.children: Mayor's $9.5k trip looks like 'cheeky European vacay', councillor says

image.altText: Kylie Minogue and Jason Donovan in a publicity still from Neighbours in 1987.

props.synopsis: After more than 9,000 episodes, Neighbours is finally coming to a close at the end of the year but not before we take one more walk down memory lane.

title.children: Weddings, deaths and cancellations: Neighbours at 40

image.altText: A police officer stands at a camera tripod in front of a crime scene and police car.

props.synopsis: A further three teenagers have been charged with murder following a fatal stabbing in Melbourne's south-east last week.

title.children: Three more charged with murder after Melbourne south-east stabbing

image.altText: a stage with triple j banners and fireworks going off as a crowd watches

props.synopsis: The triple j One Night Stand is back for 2025, bringing one regional town an incredible night of live music this May.

title.children: Why triple j chose this small town for their biggest concert of the year

image.altText: Danny Nikolic wearing a brown long sleeve leaning against a street pole

props.synopsis: Former champion jockey Danny Nikolic and lawyer Patrick Lennon have appeared before the Melbourne Magistrates' Court after allegedly stealing luxury items valued at $177,000.

title.children: Jewellery, Toyota Hilux among items champion jockey allegedly attempted to steal

image.altText: A tractor is pictured on a dry hill in regional Victoria with some hay being unrolled

props.synopsis: Paddocks in Victoria's north and east have been replenished by a big dump of rain, but some farmers fear the regions that need it most are going without.

title.children: Drought conditions worsen in parts of Victoria despite downpour

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: Successive governments have increased the tax on cigarettes and tobacco to drive down smoking rates — but having helped with one problem, it has contributed to another.

title.children: Up in smoke: How Australia's fight with big tobacco fuelled a black market
